12.title: year one

choices: Ron damands tha Hermione get off his friend

121.content:
With the assistance of a red haired family, Harry had managed to find his way onto Platform 9 3/4, and had boarded the Hogwarts Express.

The youngest boy of the red haired family, Ron had joined Harry in their compartment and now they were sat opposite each other, tucking into a selection of sweets that Harry had bought. As they ate, Ron showed Harry his new pet rat.

"My brother, Fred showed me a spell to turn him yellow" Ron pointed out "want to see?"
"Alright."

Just as Ron took out his wand, a girl appeared at the doorway of their compartment. The girl had bushy brown hair and a superior expression. She was already wearing her Hogwarts robes over a skirt and top. She seemed not be paying any attention to the boys themselves, at first for her first question was one she appeared to be asking everybody she met. "Has anybody seen a toad?" she asked "a boy called Neville has lost one?"

"No" Ron answered for himself and Harry.

It was at this point that the girl seemed to notice Ron, and his and.

"Oh, are you doing magic?" she asked him "let's see then."

Without being asked, she walked into their compartment and sat down next to Ron, opposite Harry. Harry got a view of her knees sticking out of her skirt and her legs dangling over the edge of the chair as she sat.

"Sunshine daisies, butter mellow. Turn this stupid fat rat yellow." Ron waved his wand around as though he expected something to come from it.

Hermione wasn't impressed.
"Are you sure that's a real spell? Well it's not very good, is it? I've only tried a few simple ones myself but they all worked for me."

She looked over at Harry and noticed that his glasses ere damaged. She raised her wand."

"Ocular reparo!"

Harry's glasses fixed themselves, and he noticed that his eyesight had improved. He brushed his hair aside as though to get a better look at the girl.

That was when she saw his scar.

"Holy cricket!" she declared "you're Harry Potter."

"Yes" Harry agreed.

"Let me introduce myself" she advised him as she stood up from her chair and started walking towards him.

Harry raised his hand, thinking the girl would shake it and give her name. Wasn't that how people normally introduced themselves?

She brushed his hand aside, as she turned so that her back as towards him.

"That won't be necessary" she informed him.

Then she sat.

The girl sat upon the seat that Harry was already occupying, and upon Harry himself. He felt her weight suddenly bearing down upon him, her warm body, her nearness. He couldn't see much else as her back pressed against him, blocking his view.

"I'm Hermione Granger" she finally gave her name as she relaxed and allowed her full weight to claim the boy beneath her.
121.title: On the train, dominated by Hermione

choices: Offer for your face to be her seat, because it’s more comfortable
Ask her if you can worship her in any other way
1212.content:
“Hermione, why are you sitting on me?” Harry asked with a baffled look on his face, was this a Wizarding tradition?
The look on Ron’s face told him otherwise.
“Honestly, you boys and your stupid masculine pride! I simply sat on the most comfortable surface in here, and I thought that you were the best option. Now sit down, be quiet and suck it up,”
Hermione’s domineering tone slightly put him off, but he found he rather liked it too. At the Dursley’s he had dealt with always being the subservient one of the lot, honestly serving the every need and whim of a pretty girl rather than his barbaric family was a million times better.
“Mate, you can’t just-“
Harry cut him off, “I’m fine with this. Her reason is valid and it isn’t like it’s painful!”
He didn’t see this, but Hermione’s smile brightened considerably hearing Harry’s response.
“Honestly Ronald, if you don’t like it you can find another compartment,” she said crossing her arms.
“Maybe I will!” He said with a harrumph as he stormed out with his things out of the compartment.
“Thank you. You’re at least not as dunderheaded as that boy...”
Seeing Harry’s hesitant expression, Hermione continued.
“Ok, something is bothering you my little chair. What is it?
1212.title: Hermione tells Harry why she is sitting on him

1213.content:
Hermione continued to sit on Harry, smiling as she felt The Boy Who Lived buried beneath her.

"I have to admit" she smiled at him "you are a very comfortable seat. It is a pleasure to be using you."

"Why are you sitting on Harry?" Ron asked her

"That is not your concern" she answered "you can stay if you want, but know that Harry is mine."

"He is my friend."

"He was your friend, now he is mine."

"You're not his friend. Friends don't behave that way toward each other."

"I never said he was my friend, I said he was mine."

"I don't understand."

"Not my concern."

"What are you going to do to him?"

"What does it look like I'm doing?"

"It looks like you are sitting on him."

"That answers your question then. Maybe if you stayed, some girl will come in and sit on you."

"Not likely, I'm going." Ron stood up.

"You can leave the sweets."

Grumbling, Ron left them alone.

Hermione looked out of the window. "We'll be at Hogsmeade before long" she told Harry. You should get dressed, I'll see you at Hogwarts."

As Hermione departed, finally. Harry stood and started changing into his new robes.
1213.title: The train will arrive at Hogsmeade in a few min...

choices: The girls are enjoying the slow
An hour later...
12132.content:
The procession of first year students filed into the Great Hall, Harry and Hermione among them. Ron was also in the group but ever since Hermione had joined them on the train, he had been keeping his distance from Harry. He didn't want the girl to get bored with Harry and start picking on him.

Hermione was not bored with Harry, not in the slightest. She was busy thinking, feeling it was time for Harry to resume his place beneath her but not entirely sure if she'd be able to pull it off yet or if she'd have to wait until after the sorting.

The students were brought to the front of the Great Hall, in front of groups of older students who were sat at the four house tables. Before them stood a wooden stool and an old hat. Some of the people in line understood the significance of the hat, but others did not. Those that didn't were surprised hen a rim opened in the hat and it started to sing.

Once the hat had completed its song and everyone applauded, Professor McGonagall who had escorted them into the hall took out a sheet of parchment. "When I call your name" she instructed "you will come forward and sit on the stool. I will place the sorting hat on your head and it will probe your mind and tell you which house is yours."

She then started down the list of names, in alphabetical order.

"Abbott, Hannah."

As Hannah Abbott was being sorted, Hermione considered her options. How was she going to get Harry onto the chair, to sit on him when the time came? How would she get that stern old witch to approve? Curiously, she thought the secret lay in pursuading the hat itself to go along with her plan.

The students continued to be sorted, until eventually...

"Granger, Hermione"

Hermione came forward alone and sat on the stool. Harry watched her. He recalled that she had sat on him on the train, but now she was alone on the stool. He had no way to know that she planned to correct that oversight, as she saw it though.

"You have a keen and agile mind, I see" the hat began "Rowena would like that, also a strong sense of decency and ethics that would suit you well for Gryffindor..."

"Don't sort me yet" Hermione requested, looking over at Harry who was still stood in line.

"You have designs on that boy" the hat remarked.

"Yes."

"You have sat on him already."

"Yes, he is the most comfortable seat I ever knew" she purred her thought "a girl should be comfortable when she is sorted."

"Why should I grant your request?"

"It's him or you" Hermione sent back "either you let me sit on Harry during the sorting, or I'll sit on you instead. You'll struggle to announce people's houses after I turn you into a frizbee."

"I see your point" the hat concurred "very well, hand me to Professor McGonagall."

Hermione lifted the hat from her head.

"You have not yet been sorted" McGonagall informed her.

"The hat wants to speak with you."

"Very well" the woman snorted, clearly not happy that the sorting had been interrupted "hand it over."

Hermione did so and McGonagall placed the sorting hat on her own head. Hermione could hear the professor speaking out loud a she addressed the hat.

"Yes?"
"Are you serious."
"It's somewhat unauthodox."
"Oh very well."

She handed the hat back to Hermione, who hadn't heard the full discussion but it seemed that the aged professor was going to go along with her plan.
As she placed the hat back on her own head, she heard the woman call out:

"Potter, Harry."

Harry came forward, a stunned look on his face.
"It's not my turn yet" he pointed out "she hasn't been sorted yet."
"I have a name" Hermione advised him "I doubt you have forgotten it already."
"Miss Granger desires your aid, Potter" McGonagall informed him.
"What for?"

"There's something wrong with my seat" Hermione informed him.
"It looks okay to me."
"It doesn't feel right, I think there is something missing."
"What do you want me to do?"
"Could you try it for me?"
"You are occupying it."
"Don't state the obvious, Harry/"

Hermione lifted herself off the chair, slightly - enough for Harry to just about get into place under her. She hovered over the stool, using one hand to keep herself in place.
"You aren't giving me much room."
"You'll have to cope, you aren't getting any more.

Harry sighed and started edging onto the seat. It required a lot of shuffling for Harry had virtually no room at all. Hermione's butt was so close to him that he rubbed against her every time he moved. Hermione smiled whenever he did, she was enjoying feeling him shift into place under there.

"Are you in place?" she asked, when she felt no more motion from the boy.
"Yes."
"Is the chair comfortable?"
"I guess, as comfrtable as you can expect a wooden stool to be."
"My seat isn't made out of wood" she pointed out "not any more."
Hermione settled back into place, seating herself on the boy who suddenly found himself buried beneath her once more."
"Yes, that is far more comfortable" she approved.

She sent her thought to the hat. "Take your time sorting me" she advised "I didn't sit on Harry for very long on the train, this time I plan to stay a while."
"How long do you require?"
"What is the record for the longest ever hatstall?"
"42 minutes."
"Let's break that record, I don't think an hour is too much to ask for."
"People are likely to get bored."
"Not the girls, I think they'll be entertained. The boys don't really matter."
"Fine."
12132.title: Hermione sits on Harry during the sorting

132.content:
Harry sat at the dining table at the Weasley home, Mrs Weasley and all the males of the Weasley clan were sat down for breakfast with him. Harry had arrived just a few hours earlier, travelling in the flying Ford Anglia, driven by Ron and the twins. Those responsible (except for Harry) had been severely reprimanded by Mrs Weasley and now the family were all sitting down for breakfast.

From behind, there was the sound of footsteps, followed by a girl's voice, asking her mother if she had seen a certain article of clothing.
Mrs Weasley was just giving her response when the red haired girl caught sight of their new guest. Smiling to herself, she drew out her new wand.

Harry suddenly felt his body being held firmly against the chair, which slid back from the table a couple of feet. Smiling broadly now, the girl walked up to the table and stood in front of Harry. Harry could see her long, red hair hanging loosely down her back, and her young, feminine body in front of him. He was still trapped against the seat, even his arms were pinned to his sides. He could not move. He watched the girl, wondering what she was going to do next.

Harry had to admit she was a beautiful girl, with a strong, firm, body and wonderfully proportioned rear. His eyes were drawn to her butt, and whether the girl was aware of this or not, she didn't seem to pay any attention.

"Are you joining us for breakfast, Ginny dear?" her mother asked.

"Of course" Ginny smiled, and she sat.

She sat on the chair that Harry was already occupying, as though he wasn't even there, as though she didn't know that she had just pinned him to it precisely for this purpose. Of course she knew. Ginny always knew what she was doing.

Harry felt her full weight suddenly bearing down upon him, sitting on him, using him.

Ginny continued not to pay any attention to him at all as she started to fill her (formally his) plate with foodstuffs.
132.title: At The Burrow, dominated by Ginny
